demos.recipe_text: Rinse the jasmin rice (50g) and white quinoa (30g) under running water to get rid of the starch. Pour the water into a saucepan, add the rice and quinoa, season with salt (2g) and simmer on a medium heat. Rinse and pat dry the turkey breast fillets (125g) or chicken breast fillets (125g) gently with paper towel. Cut them into cubes. Defrost the frozen corn (40g) and frozen green beans (40g) and cut into slices. Often these are already prepared for you. Peel red onion (40g) and finely chop along with red bell peppers (40g). Heat a frying pan with a little oil (1 tbsp) and sauté the onion and pepper for 5 minutes. Add the turkey or chicken fillets to the vegetables, stir-fry for about 5 minutes and add the green beans and corn, stir-fry for another 5 minutes. The quinoa rice should be cooked by this time, just check to make sure it is al dente. Remove side dish from the heat. Add the tinned tomatoes (40g) to the turkey, add sugar (5g) to balance acidity and salt (1/2 tsp) to taste. Braise for 5 minutes. Place the quinoa rice on a plate and top with the turkey/chicken and vegetables. Garnish with chopped parsley.

Pour the @water{} into a #saucepan, add the rice and quinoa, season with @salt{2%g} and simmer on a medium heat. Add the turkey or chicken fillets to the vegetables, stir-fry for about ~{5%minutes} and add the green beans and corn, stir-fry for another ~{5%minutes}. The quinoa rice should be cooked by this time, just check to make sure it is al dente. Remove side dish from the heat. Add the @tinned tomatoes{40%g} to the turkey, add @sugar{5%g} to balance acidity and @salt{1/2%tsp} to taste. Braise for ~{5%minutes}. Place the quinoa rice on a plate and top with the turkey/chicken and vegetables. Garnish with chopped @parsley{}.

demos.recipe_text: Pour 400g of water into a saucepan and put on a medium heat. Peel and cut the potatoes (60g) into large pieces (if the potatoes are small with thin skin, you can simply rinse them and cut them in half without peeling), peel the carrots (30g) and cut them into smaller chunks. Place the vegetables into the pan and boil covered with a lid on until soft. Next, cut the salmon fillet (40g) and hake fillet (40g) into large pieces and add to the vegetables, add soy sauce (30g) and fish sauce (20g), halved cherry tomatoes (20g), chopped green peppers (5g) and double cream (50g). It is not necessary to cook for a long time, so as not to overcook the fish, it is enough to bring the soup gently to a boil.

Peel and cut the @potatoes{60%g} into large pieces (if the potatoes are small with thin skin, you can simply rinse them and cut them in half without peeling), peel the @carrots{30%g} and cut them into smaller chunks. Place the vegetables into the pan and boil covered with a lid on until soft. Next, cut the @salmon fillet{40%g} and @hake fillet{40%g} into large pieces and add to the vegetables, add @soy sauce{30%g} and @fish sauce{20%g}, halved @cherry tomatoes{20%g}, chopped @green peppers{5%g} and @double cream{50%g}. It is not necessary to cook for a long time, so as not to overcook the fish, it is enough to bring the soup gently to a boil.

Peel and cut the @potatoes{60%g} into large pieces (if the potatoes are small with thin skin, you can simply rinse them and cut them in half without peeling), peel the @carrots{30%g} and cut them into smaller chunks. Next, cut the @salmon fillet{40%g} and @hake fillet{40%g} into large pieces and add to the vegetables, add @soy sauce{30%g} and @fish sauce{20%g}, halved @cherry tomatoes{20%g}, chopped @green peppers{5%g} and @double cream{50%g}. It is not necessary to cook for a long time, so as not to overcook the fish, it is enough to bring the soup gently to a boil.

demos.recipe_text: Pour 3.5 litres of cold water into a large saucepan, rinse the chicken wings (750g) under running water and place in the pot with the water. Put the pot on a high heat, skimming off any protein foam as it forms on top. Meanwhile peel the carrots (200g) and onions (200g). The carrots can be cut lengthwise and the onions in half. As soon as the broth starts to boil, add the carrots and onions. Add salt (2 tsp) to season and reduce the heat to a low simmer for 60-90 minutes. After the broth has simmered, strain it into another pan to remove the onions and chicken wings and allow to cool. Keep the carrots to finely chop and add to the broth. Shred some of the meat from the wings and add as well. Check for seasoning and enjoy.\
demos.rationale: Cooklang: Pour @water{3.5%litres} into a #large saucepan, rinse the @chicken wings{750%g} under running water and place in the pot with the water. Put the pot on a high heat, skimming off any protein foam as it forms on top. Meanwhile peel the @carrots{200%g} and @onions{200%g}. The carrots can be cut lengthwise and the onions in half. As soon as the broth starts to boil, add the carrots and onions. Add @salt{2%tsp} to season and reduce the heat to a low simmer for ~{60-90%minutes}. After the broth has simmered, strain it into another #pan to remove the onions and chicken wings and allow to cool. Keep the carrots to finely chop and add to the broth. Shred some of the meat from the wings and add as well. Check for seasoning and enjoy.
demos.cooklang: Pour @water{3.5%litres} into a #large saucepan, rinse the @chicken wings{750%g} under running water and place in the pot with the water. Put the pot on a high heat, skimming off any protein foam as it forms on top. Meanwhile peel the @carrots{200%g} and @onions{200%g}. The carrots can be cut lengthwise and the onions in half. As soon as the broth starts to boil, add the carrots and onions. Add @salt{2%tsp} to season and reduce the heat to a low simmer for ~{60-90%minutes}. After the broth has simmered, strain it into another #pan to remove the onions and chicken wings and allow to cool. Keep the carrots to finely chop and add to the broth. Shred some of the meat from the wings and add as well. Check for seasoning and enjoy.

demos.recipe_text: Preheat the oven to 180°C before beginning your prep. Rinse the bream (450g) or your choice of fish (cod, seabass, or catfish), remove any scales that may remain, as well as fins. You can mostly have this done by your local fishmonger. Make a slit in the back, separate the flesh from the bones using a flat fish knife, cut out the centre bone. Remove the guts, rinse and pat dry with paper towel. Again, one can usually buy the fish already prepared for you. Rinse and pat dry courgette (50g), lemon (40g), red bell pepper (50g) and cherry tomatoes (30g). Peel the red onion (30g) and slice the onion into half rings, cut courgettes into thin rounds and the red pepper into medium slices, halve the cherry tomatoes. Drizzle the fish with freshly squeezed lemon juice and a sprinkle of olive oil, then season with salt and a grind of black pepper. Heat a frying pan over medium heat with a little oil just to prevent sticking and help with browning. Sauté the chopped vegetables with the Provence herbs (1/2 tsp) and salt and pepper. On a flat baking tray, place the fish on tin foil with the shiny side down so as not to reflect the heat, you can also use baking paper. Stuff the fish with the roasted vegetables and bake for 15 minutes. It is also nice to top the fish with fresh fennel for baking, if you should have any around. After baking, take the fish out of the oven and place on a platter, garnish with either fresh or roasted cherry tomatoes, roasted whole garlic cloves (these can be done when baking the fish) and wedges of lemon. The fish also goes nicely with baby new potatoes and garlic butter.
demos.cooklang: Preheat the oven to 180°C before beginning your prep.  Rinse the @bream{450%g} or your choice of fish,[- TODO |@cod|@seabass|@catfish -], remove any scales that may remain, as well as fins. You can mostly have this done by your local fishmonger. Make a slit in the back, separate the flesh from the bones using a flat fish knife, cut out the centre bone. Rove the guts, rinse and pat dry with paper towel. Again, one can usually buy the fish already prepared for you.  Rinse and pat dry @courgette{50%g}, @lemon{40%g}, @red bell pepper{50%g} and @cherry tomatoes{30%g}. Peel the @red onion{30%g} and slice the onion into half rings, cut courgettes into thin rounds and the red pepper into medium slices, halve the cherry tomatoes.  Drizzle the fish with freshly squeezed lemon juice and a sprinkle of olive oil, then season with @salt and a grind of black pepper. Heat a #frying pan{} over medium heat with a little @oil just to prevent sticking and help with browning. Sauté the chopped vegetables with the @provence herbs{1/2%tsp} and @salt and pepper.  On a flat #baking tray{}, place the fish on #tin foil{} with the shiny side down so as not to reflect the heat, you can also use baking paper. stuff the fish with the roasted vegetables and bake for ~{15%minutes}. It is also nice to top the fish with fresh fennel for baking, if you should have any around.  After baking, take the fish out of the oven and place on a platter, garnish with either fresh or roasted cherry tomatoes, roasted whole garlic cloves (these can be done when baking the fish) and wedges of lemon. The fish also goes nicely with baby new potatoes and garlic butter.

demos.recipe_text: In a large mixing bowl mix together the flour (3 cups), baking powder (1 tbsp), garlic salt (1 tsp), sugar (1/2 cup), shredded Cheddar cheese (1 cup) and green onions (3). Mix in the beer (12 oz) using as few strokes as possible until the mix is well moistened. Pour the batter (it will be thick) into a greased bread loaf pan. Drizzle with melted butter (1/2 cup) on top before baking. Bake for 50 minutes in a 375 degree oven, allow to cool.
demos.cooklang: In a large #mixing bowl{} mix together the @flour{3%cups}, @baking powder{1%tbsp}, @garlic salt{1%tsp}, @sugar{1/2%cup}, shredded @Cheddar cheese{1%cup} and @green onions{3}.  Mix in the @beer{12%oz} using as few strokes as possible until the mix is well moistened.  Pour the batter (it will be thick) into a greased bread #loaf pan{}.  Drizzle with melted @butter{1/2%cup} on top before baking.  Bake for ~{50%minutes} in a 375 degree #oven{}, allow to cool.

prog.signature_instructions:
Convert plain recipe text with provided ingredients into Cooklang text format.
Return only Cooklang formatted recipe, dont return any other information. Return whole recipe in Cooklang format! Dont stop till you reach the end of the recipe.
prog.extended_signature_instructions:
Each recipe in the dataset is meticulously structured, featuring detailed, explicit mentions of ingredients with quantities and consistent use of the `cooklang` syntax, denoted by specific annotations for ingredients, equipment, and timings. The instructions are clear and step-by-step, ensuring procedural clarity and ease of execution, while maintaining a balance between conciseness and completeness. Additionally, versatility in ingredient options and health-conscious choices are noted, suggesting a potential focus on balanced nutrition. Summary: The dataset comprises well-structured recipes with explicit ingredients, precise measurements, and detailed step-by-step instructions, consistently using `cooklang` syntax for automated processing. It is designed to support various applications including interactive cooking systems, culinary AI training, and food analysis, with a focus on clarity, procedural accuracy, and nutritional balance.

PROGRAM CODE:
StringSignature(recipe_text -> rationale, cooklang
    instructions='Convert plain recipe text with provided ingredients into Cooklang text format.\nReturn only Cooklang formatted recipe, dont return any other information. Return whole recipe in Cooklang format! Dont stop till you reach the end of the recipe.'
    recipe_text = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Recipe text to convert to Cooklang format.', '__dspy_field_type': 'input', 'prefix': 'Recipe Text:'})
    rationale = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'prefix': "Reasoning: Let's think step by step in order to", 'desc': '${produce the cooklang}. We ...', '__dspy_field_type': 'output'})
    cooklang = Field(annotation=str required=True json_schema_extra={'desc': 'Cooklang formatted recipe.', '__dspy_field_type': 'output', 'prefix': 'Cooklang:'})
)

class CookLangFormatterNoStepsNoIngredients(dspy.Module):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()

        self.prog = dspy.ChainOfThought(CookLangSignatureNoStepsNoIngredients)

    def forward(self, recipe_text: str) -> CookLangSignatureNoStepsNoIngredients:
        prediction = self.prog(recipe_text=recipe_text)
        return prediction


PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: The program is designed to convert plain recipe text into the Cooklang format. Cooklang is a specific notation system used to write recipes in a structured and standardized way. Here's how the program works: 1. **Input Processing**: The program takes a plain recipe text as input. This input is required as specified by the `recipe_text` field in the `StringSignature`. 2. **Instruction**: The program is given specific instructions to convert the provided recipe text into Cooklang formatting. It is instructed to return only the Cooklang formatted recipe and not any other information, ensuring the output is clean and adheres strictly to the Cooklang specifications. 3. **Processing & Conversion**: - A class `CookLangFormatterNoStepsNoIngredients` extends `dspy.Module`. - The class initializes with a `ChainOfThought` process named `CookLangSignatureNoStepsNoIngredients`, which suggests the use of a step-by-step logical reasoning method to carry out the transformation. - The `forward` method of this class takes the plain recipe text and processes it using this chain of thought to output the Cooklang formatted recipe. 4. **Output Specification**: The fields `rationale` and `cooklang` are marked as required outputs. `rationale` seems to annotate or explain the transformation process, while `cooklang` is the final output in Cooklang format. 5. **Calling the Chain of Thought**: When the `forward` method is invoked with `recipe_text`, the `ChainOfThought` process is called to generate the prediction (i.e., the Cooklang formatted recipe). In summary, the program automates the conversion of traditional recipe texts into a standardized Cooklang format using a structured approach involving specified instructions and a chain of reasoning. This process ensures that each step from input to output is logically and systematically handled.

MODULE: self.prog = dspy.ChainOfThought(CookLangSignatureNoStepsNoIngredients)

TASK DEMO(S):

BASIC INSTRUCTION:
Convert plain recipe text with provided ingredients into Cooklang text format.
Return only Cooklang formatted recipe, dont return any other information. Return whole recipe in Cooklang format! Dont stop till you reach the end of the recipe.

TIP: Make sure your instruction is very informative and descriptive.

PROPOSED INSTRUCTION:

---

Convert the provided plain text recipe into a structured and well-formatted Cooklang text. Carefully identify and annotate each ingredient, piece of equipment, and timing step according to the Cooklang syntax. Ensure that the entire recipe is processed without omitting any part. Return solely the Cooklang formatted recipe text and exclude any other information. Ensure that the output strictly follows the Cooklang notation standards and provides a comprehensive representation of the recipe.
